catapult.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a large weapon used in former times to throw heavy stones, iron balls etc
catapult.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a small stick in the shape of a Y with a thin rubber band fastened over the two ends, used by children to throw stones
catapult.translation[0].definitions[2].d: a piece of equipment used to send an aircraft into the air from a ship
catapult.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to push or throw something very hard so that it moves through the air very quickly
catapult.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Sam was catapulted into the air by the force of the blast.
